results.title: Le Jongleur = The Juggler
results.creator_credit: Thomas Vamos, Helene Verrier and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A juggler opens his magic box and takes out three balls. The audience marvels at his dexterity until one ball escapes. The mutinous ball assumes magical properties as it draws the juggler into a series of adventures with many levels of meaning: appearance, fantasy and love. The spectator’s age and subjective impressions determine the interpretation of this non-narrated tale.

results.title: Mollusks: the mussels - respiration and digestion
results.brief_description: Shows the systemic biology of mollusks. Illustrates exactly how the structure of the mollusk is related to its functions.
results.description: Shows the systemic biology of mollusks. Illustrates exactly how the structure of the mollusk is related to its functions.

results.title: Crystals: flowers of the mineral kingdom
results.brief_description: Discusses the shape of crystals, depicts frost farming and goes on to show simple applications of crystals. The relationship between crystal properties and uses is illustrated with aluminium.
results.description: Discusses the shape of crystals, depicts frost farming and goes on to show simple applications of crystals. The relationship between crystal properties and uses is illustrated with aluminium.

results.title: Chicago's modern architecture
results.creator_credit: George Barford, Egons Tomsons and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: A comprehensive look at Chicago’s modern architecture. Covers the Chicago school, modernism and post-modernism and shows the way in which the post modernists attempt to revive classical architectural features. Includes works by Sullivan, Richardson, Wright, Burnham and Root, Jeny, Van der Rohe, Yamasaki and Elmut Jahn.

results.title: Special effects
results.brief_description: Provides an intriguing look at certain special effects employed by Oxford Scientific Films mainly in their biological and scientific productions. Also shows the scientific effects generated for some science fiction films. Highlights the need to plan and set up shots well.

results.title: That's stealing
results.creator_credit: Tony Schmitz, Sandra Schieck, Thom Eberhardt and FilmFair Communications
results.brief_description: An open ended program designed to promote discussion about the nature of friendship and trust in relation to the possible theft of a bracelet by one girl from a friend. Useful in circumstances where theft occurs in classrooms.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Schmitz, Sandra Schieck, Thom Eberhardt and FilmFair Communications

results.title: Computers, spies and private lives
results.creator_credit: Linda Harrar, Theodore Bogosian and Time-Life Video
results.brief_description: Reveals how computers that are routinely gathering information on our finances, politics, tastes and habits may pose a threat to our individual privacy.

results.title: You and your school council
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Mark Laughlin and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Highlights the new roles and responsibilities of school councils. Emphasizes the participation of parents, students and teachers in school governance; and the importance of collaborative decision making in developing school policies and priorities. Encourages parents to become involved in school councils.

results.title: Seeing by numbers
results.creator_credit: Janice Kay, Bob Thorpe and London Television Service
results.brief_description: Presents the history of information from the 13th century and the new ways we can communicate. Shows everyday applications of numerical analysis in such areas as weather forecasting, telephone information systems, education and business.

results.title: The Top few inches
results.creator_credit: Jerry Krepakevich and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Depicts impact of farming on the soils of Canada from the 1930s to the present. Shows soil erosion caused by poor farming techniques as well as leaching and salting due to irrigation. Emphasizes new practice of zero tillage and presents solutions to soil and land management.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jerry Krepakevich and National Film Board of Canada
